title: Salon de  B&B - Room 1 (with breakfast)
about: Stay at safe and clean place during your stay in ! Lazimpat is popular residential area for both foreign and wealthy local people because of its very clean, convenient and safe environment. The city center, Durbar Marg and Thamel, is all located in walking distance. Convenient location, safe area, super clean house with beautiful garden and good foods, any reason to hesitate? ;)

reviews.reivew: Beautiful location with a nice café and restaurant. My room was really comfortable and check in was also very easy. I definitely can recommend.
Quiet place to stay if you want to be away from the noise and dust of 's busy roads.Neat outdoor seating Good food and drinks.

Maison de  was the perfect base for my time in . The accommodation is within easy walking distance to tourist sites and great restaurants while also offering a calm, quiet and safe environment. The on-site restaurant is lovely with a beautiful garden area, great coffee and staff that are super friendly and welcoming. The room is clean with natural light and the other amenitiesavailable, such as kettle and washing machine are great. This is a wonderful property, excellent value and highly recommended!
An absolutely gorgeous airbnb in the heart of . Great value for money with an awesome group of staff/host to take care of your stay. Highly recommend, a definite 5/5 for me.
Beautiful place, loved the garden cafe. everything was perfect.

clean and neat place. smooth check-in and very helpful staff. spacious room. but no AC. a bit difficultto locate the place but overall its near the main street. easy to get taxi and public transport. The food is GOOD (8/10). Highly recommend to others

title: Salon de  B&B - Room 3 (with breakfast)
about: Stay at a safe, clean and comfortable place during your stay in ! We are located in Lazimpat, a popular residential area for expats, diplomats, tourists and locals alike because of its very clean, convenient and safe environment. The city center, Durbar Marg and Thamel, are all located within walking distance. Convenient location, safe area, super clean house with beautiful garden and good foods, any reason to hesitate? ;)

reviews.reivew: Maison/ Salon de  offered everything we were looking for - a great location, beautiful garden, good food and drinks, friendly staff and spacious rooms for ample relaxation. We are looking forward to our next visit and can definitely recommend staying here for anyone coming to .
Great location, lovely staff, and good food. Thanks for another pleasant stay at the Salon
Fantastic room and really helpful staff! The whole property feltchic and relaxed

I've stayed in all three rooms here and have only great things to say. The rooms are comfortable. The staff is friendly and helpful. And the rooms are in a house that also hosts a lovely cafe in a beautiful garden so there's a calm space to relax and tasty food on offer without even leaving the premises. Communication is easy and everyone went above and beyond to make me feel cared for. I hate to recommend this place too strongly because I want there to be space when I return. But the truth is, it's lovely, And when I return, I'll hope to stay here again!

This listing is a gem right in the heart of the city of , but tucked away enough that it is its own little piece of peaceful escape. The cafe/restaurant attached is absolutely amazing if you are craving some food from home from the western part for the world. The space is clean, bedding soft and comfortable, and the water pressure for the shower is amazing (for those who loves a good shower.) It is close to many foreign embassies, and various landmarks like Garden of Dreams. What an amazing and quiet place to stay to finish up my two week trip in Nepal!

To be completely honest,  was disappointing for us because of several reasons. We expected much more from the city. But the only reason why we stayed longer is because Jennifer and her team made our stay very pleasant, they were very helpful without mentioning the fact that they have a restaurant downstairs and the food is delicious.Maybe I wouldn't recommend  in a personal perspective, but I would definitely recommend this Airbnb if anyone was going there!

title: Accommodation Jupiter
about: Nestled amidst the vibrant streets of Mansarovar, Jaipur, this charming Airbnb retreat invites you to immerse in the essence of Rajasthan. Step into a fusion of tradition and modernity, where intricate Rajasthani artwork adorns the walls, complemented by contemporary furnishings. The spacious living area offers a cozy spot to unwind, while the well-equipped kitchen beckons culinary adventures. As the sun sets, retreat to the serene bedroom boasting plush linens and soothing hues. Wake up to the aroma of freshly brewed chai, then venture out to explore Jaipur's majestic forts or indulge in local delicacies at nearby markets. Experience Rajasthan's allure from this inviting haven.

reviews.reivew: The host is wonderful! He helped us a lot and is very nice and kind. The room is very clean and not far from fewa lake. The view of the restaurant totally worth. Not to mention the great taste. We had the best experience in Nepal thanks to the host!

We really enjoyed the stay at Accomodation Jupiter. The place was impeccably clean and the view was amazing. The staff always friendly and pleasant. Breakfast was very well presented and yummy. We even ordered some local food for dinner which was delicious.  We will definitely choose the place next time we visit Pokhara.

A really good stay here. the view is perfect,just fact the beautiful lake.you may see a sunset in a good weather l guess. the restaurant provide a tasty breakfast and good drink.  the host uncle is really nice to offer any help he can in my stay. l will choice this accommodation next time l come here.

We spent 2 nights at this beautiful place in Pokhara. Located at a quick 10 minute drive / 20 minute walk from the main lakeside market, this is a perfect spot if you're looking for a quiet place away from the market. The in-house Gusto restaurant is a very pretty spot at a top of hill mound which gives a 360 view of Pokhara. The staff is very helpful and Rana is an amazing host with great tips for local activities. Definitely one of the better places to stay in Pokhara. Look forward to being back soon.
Best you can get in Pokhara. Breakfast is amazing with varieties
very very good and very beautiful house and kind people

title: Chaamp- Cozy/exotic attic suite w/ free parking
about: Unwind and soak in the mountain air at our picturesque A-frame Attic Villa, where you will be greeted with an incredible view from floor to ceiling windows. Our thoughtfully designed attic villa is the quintessential getaway from the hustle and bustle. It's a mini-retreat for you and your family/ friends or partner to renew your love for life. Sit back relax and rediscover your inner peace at Rays & HazeThe spaceChaamp- A cozy and romantic suite with floor-to-ceiling windows and a private balcony. The modern and minimalistic decor of these rooms creates a space that defines tranquility and resonates with your inner peace. Chaamp the suite (a part of Rays & Haze) is located amidst the lush green pine trees overlooking the majestic Kanchenjunga.Rays & Haze is a double-storey property and Chaamp is located on the second floor. The first floor is aesthetically designed to create a warm, welcoming space with a fully equipped kitchenette, dining hall, and recreational space. Guests can indulge in reading, relaxing, or enjoying the rejuvenating view. We offer complimentary breakfast and beverages (tea/coffee/milk)If you do not wish to step out, we can provide home-cooked lunch, dinner, snacks, and drinks on order*

reviews.reivew: We stayed in the attic room which was charming, wood fashioned and opened its balcony to beautiful mountains & kanchenjunga view. The room was cozy and clean. The host, kausila aunty is very sweet and supportive throughout; they also provide delicious food on pre-orders and their momos are a must try!!!!
Worthy to visit to have wonderful memories with family and friends…
We had a lovely stay here. Everything was just perfect. Super clean house and rooms are beautifully done. Food was served warm and with love. We plan to be back again. Thank you!!

title: Chimal- chic/cozy room with mountain view
about: Unwind and soak in the mountain air at our picturesque A-frame Attic Villa, where you will be greeted with an incredible view from floor to ceiling windows. Our thoughtfully designed attic villa is the quintessential getaway from the hustle and bustle. It's a mini-retreat for you and your family/ friends or partner to renew your love for life. Sit back relax and rediscover your inner peace at Rays & Haze.The spaceChimal- A cozy and romantic room with modern and minimalistic decor. A perfect getaway from your busy and hectic lifestyle.This property (a part of Rays & Haze) is located amidst the lush green pine trees overlooking the majestic Kanchenjunga.Rays & Haze is a double-storey property and Chimal is located on the first floor. The first floor is aesthetically designed to create a warm, welcoming space with a fully equipped kitchenette, dining hall, and recreational space. Guests can indulge in reading, relaxing, or enjoying the rejuvenating view. We offer complimentary breakfast and beverages (tea/coffee/milk)If you do not wish to step out, we can provide home-cooked lunch, dinner, snacks, and drinks on order*

reviews.reivew: Wonderful hosts, very accommodating. Extremely clean and comfortable rooms. Food is awesome!

Excellent arrangement. Well decorated and well equipped rooms. Beautiful people make our stay very comfortable.Close to Kurseong town and the town is easily accessible. At the same time far from maddening crowd.

title: Luitel Homestay- Artsy Luxury Retreat - Room 5
about: Large airy room with attached bathroom. Rates inclusive of breakfast. Get a slice of an authentic Sikkimese home in the family house of one of the oldest Sikkimese Nepali families, hosted by the youngest son of the family; who has lived all around the world. Enjoy rooms filled with antiques, furniture and art from Sikkim, Europe and India. Fuss free stay with no restrictions on late night sojourns - as long as you respect the fact you are in a family home and not a hotel.The spaceAn independent floor in a family home. There are 5 independent rooms with attached bathrooms. 3 rooms havebalconies. There is also a cosy common living room and a dining area. We also provide delicious home made food using all organic produce sourced from our farm in West Sikkim and our own grounds around the house. The food menu reflects my own history - Food that I grew up with in Sikkim and food that I grew to love during my stays all around the world. We also have a wide selection of drinks on offer.No loud music or noise after 9 pm.The house sits in a large private gated compound with 3 large greenhouses growing vegetables and many varieties of fruits - Plums, Peaches, Lime, Lemons, Oranges, Apples, Crab Apples, Grapes and seasonal local vegetables. We have a large vegetable gardens where we grow all kinds of local vegetables through out the year and there is a chicken coop. Guests are free to walk around the grounds and I can give a tour showing you all the produce we grow.We aim to be a Eco-friendly operation and a lot of thought has gone into every single detail - our teas are sourced from the organic tea estate in Sikkim and our coffee is sourced from an organic plantation in Nagaland. All our toiletries are made especially for us and are 100% natural. Even our cleaning supplies are 100% natural with no harmful chemicals. We have even managed to source bio degradable garbage bags! Please use as little plastic as possible during your trip. We are happy to provide you filtered water for free - please carry a reusable bottle along for your trip and lets try and keep Sikkim plastic free!!Guest accessOther than the spacious rooms, the guests have access to the drawing room, the dining area and the grounds around the house. Once in a while we also let guest have access to our amazing terrace.

reviews.reivew: Great place and very accommodating hosts. Helped us with everything and made our stay really comfortable

It was a lovely staycation. Learnt so much aboutthe culture and food. Amrit was kind to teach us how to make momos from scratch. The entire property is beautiful with a huge kitchen garden, with literally everything in it. From nectarines to avocados to bluberries. Loved the Sikkim thali he offered for dinner the day we landed, we wiped the whole plate within minutes. A must, if you ever visit Gangtok.

Amrit's place was perfect for our vacation, from start to finish! We got the friendliest, warmest welcome after a very long day, and feltat home right from the beginning. They're helpful when we need information aboutplaces, permits and booking, are full of stories aboutthe different parts of Sikkim and the ways of life, and will make sure your evenings are unforgettably fun (if you choose it), even after a day of long hikes! They'll really take care of you. Amrit knows the best places to find the right things in the city – momos, thongba, friendly pubs, art, meat, traditional things, monasteries – and all the inside information. He's also got an enviable collection of books, art and curios all over the house. And some evenings, lovely Nepali music. And there's so many birds to see from the balconies! (Amrit can ID most of these for you, but don't trust him on the names of stars.) We stayed a week here, but wanted some more. The house is a very short taxi ride from MG Marg, and the taxi stop is right around the corner. If you go during the right season, Amrit's garden will be bursting with fruits and vegetables. Ask him aboutthe local ingredients and cuisine!Very happy we chose Amrit's place in Gangtok. Feltlike family :)

Luitel Homestay is a lovely place to be.. Amrit,the host is very friendly and not only helps with the direction to reach his place but provides you with all the options available to roam around in the city. The dinner they prepare with their home grown vegetables and the presentation is an experience in itself.
Overall, I had a great experience with the him. The room was wonderful, clean, and perfect .

Amrit is gem of a person. He is compassionate, humble and he goes an extra mile to elevate your experience. He is great drinking company and you can talk to him practically abouteverything!I wish we could have stayed longer. There's always a next time. Thanks buddy, we will miss you.

title: Secluded stay @Gangtok
about: A perfect getaway for guests travelling to Gangtok and at the same time looking for a peaceful neighborhood , with nature all around.Food will be completely homecooked and organic. Sikkimese cuisine like momo, thukpa also available.*Breakfast is complimentary.The spaceA new builtproperty, well furnished and maintained.  An urban homestay I'd like to say. Good Hi speed internet is available.

reviews.reivew: Nice hospitality 👍
Very cooperative and lovely Host. Good Homemade Food. Simplicity. Peace. The only issue is connectivity from MG Road.
Amazing food - Organically procured from farm. The view from terrace at night & morning will steal your heart.Mukku the love dog will make you enjoy the day.

title: Hug Inn Phrae- Double bed
about: A homey bed and breakfast in Phrae, Thailand with trendy but well priced in the loft-like style. Cozy stay with a few minutes walk to old town.We have 4 room types ready for your stay ; Family room (for up to 8 guests - 72 sqm), Connecting room (4 guest - 48 sqm), Loft room (3 guests -36 sqm), Standard room (2 guests - 24 spm). All rooms are available with an air-conditioner, a flatscreen TV, a refrigerator, sitting are, private bath room, water heater. Cafe' in the same area open everyday.

reviews.reivew: Newly builtclean building. Host friendly. Delicious breakfast. Comfortable cafe. Everything was good.

title: Baan Sri Dha - Lanna Style Home & Yoga
about: Our charming home is semi wooden with 3 A/C bedroomsand 3 bathrooms. It is equipped with a kitchen, a bar, fiber optic wifi and a large open space upstairs. It is perfect for a family with children or a group of friends. We are 10 minutes walking distance from Chiangmai Gate and the Saturday walking street. We offer complimentary home cooked breakfast every morning and a complimentary pick up service from the airport.The spaceThe two story house is builtwith teak wood and concrete. There are two bedrooms(a double bed and a single bed), one bathroom and the open seating space upstairs. On the bottom floor, there is one bedroom (a double bed), a working room and two bathrooms. The house is equipped with a kitchen, a small bar and the front yard. The space is suitable for a family or a group of friends who wish to relax in the heart of Chiangmai.

reviews.reivew: a phenomenal experience. beautiful large wooden house with comfortable bedand great air conditioning. close to a few small restaurants and walking distance to the busy areas.  the hosts are amazing and we're available anytime. we had forgotten something at the house and mo personally delivered it to the airport before we left chiangmai.I fully recommend this place to any and all.

I don’t even know where to begin, the most incredible hosts/staff I could ever imagine. My friend and I feltso welcomed after a long day of travelling to a cold drink and a guided tour up a mountain on a motor bike that the staff helped us organize. Every day was filled with ideas of what we could do, where to go and what to see which made every day very successful. “No plan is the best plan” is what we learned and we are forever grateful. The house is everything you want for a treehouse vibe including the geckos, 10/10.
What a great airbnb! Great location, authentic, superb hosts, lovely breakfast

Hands down, the BEST experience I've had on this website. From the pickup at the airport to the check-in, up until the moment of picking up our bags at the end of our stay, everything was absolutely phenomenal. The property itself was beautiful. A wonderful mix of greenery and traditional wooden structure, we could not have asked for a better stay. The rooms were very spacious, and we especially loved the second floor outdoor lounging area! Perfect place to get together with your group before you go back inside your rooms or leave for the day. The location was great, just minutes away from the Chiang Mai Gate, and within all the designated pick-up areas for my adventures. I walked from the gate to the house alone at night and feltvery safe. It's also in a very residential part, slightly away from all the action (but close enough to walk to the action), which was great as we didn't have to deal with any noise at night.I do need to give a shout-out to the breakfast! I opted for breakfast every day of my trip, and it was so delicious I still dream aboutit. The food itself was absolutely phenomenal, and the team that prepared it were such great wholesome people! My elephant sanctuary pickup came a little earlier than expected, and the team made sure I had enough food with me so I wouldn't be hungry (and I was so happy they did because otherwise I would've been so hungry throughout the day).Also another shoutout for Mo and Ton and the team for being the most helpful and wonderful hosts anyone could ask for! Even from before my trip, they helped me with reservations for all of my adventures, and during the trip whenever I had any questions they were so quick to respond, I never feltconfused or lost.

Amazing! You feel like in a rural area with squirells, bats, and geckos... but 5 mins walk to old city. Very unique and traditional style house and furnishings... but there is aircon and WiFi. Plus they offer you a fully cooked breakfast in the morning with coffee and fresh fruit. They can organise a driver or a tour or anything! English speaker staff. Perfect trip. I will definitely stay again

Wow!!  We had an amazing stay. I wish we would have stayed longer. The house is really beautiful and spacious. My husband and kid did a cooking class. I was afraid fours hours would be too long, but they stayed fully engaged. They ran to the kitchen the next morning to help cook!  The staff were incredibly nice. I definitely recommend you stay here😍

title: Maya Homestay Peora - Bed & Breakfast
about: We are situated in Peora village. From our elevated home, up above the main cluster of village homes one can see the green hills of Kumaon while Almora glitters in the near distance. We are in the midst of fruit bearing orchards full of apricot, plum, pear, malta and peach trees.On a clear day one can see the high Himalayas from our house starting from Chaukhamba till Panchachuli.A delicious local breakfast is also part of your stay.The spaceThe room is on the top floor of the independent block and part of larger Maya's Homestay. A spacious room nicely lit with a rustic look and mud plastered walls and a wooden flooring. There is a working space with a desk and chair facing a large window opening up to the most scenic view of the hills. The window also comes with alcove seating from where one can watch the skies unfold their magic. The room has a modern bathroom with all the amenities. There is a private sit-out overlooking apricot and peach trees. There is a newly set-up stone and brick table in the courtyard which also doubles up as a place to eat your meals or drink your tea/coffee.The family has two dogs and a cat.

reviews.reivew: Nestled amidst a grove of flowering trees, shrubs and creepers Maya’s homestay offers a simple, clean and beautifully slow way of life. This is to say that utilities are easily available including a good mobile network.Maya Ji and her family are very  hospitable with Maya Ji’s delectable cooking being a show stealer which alone shall leave you yearning for more. The Himalayan peaks in the distance and the valley beneath the home are views one can not have enough. Alcoves of Himalayan birds are plentiful in the crooked pathways and and roads surrounding the property.The room is quite cozy and comfortable with a window that offers a pristinely serene view. And it does have hot water supply.They also have insanely cute pets.
it was one of the most memorable stays we had. Maya di is an exceptional host and a great cook..

Beautiful place, beautiful host. Maya's homestay is away from the main road. It's a 500 mtr village walk from the main road. Maya and her husband both are great human beings. Especially, Maya's husband. He is a gentleman and always has a smile on his face, no matter what. The room is cosy and a perfect place to chill. It gives you a spectacular view of the mountains.  It has a study table and amazing books to read. The hosts live in the same vicinity and are quite reachable. Honestly, you would even feel the need to reach out to them, they are very proactive and understanding. They will offer you chai multiple times and would make sure you are having a comfortable stay. The food here is no fuss home-cooked delicious food. The best part is that the hosts will eat with you. Maya's husband works at a post office in Mukteshwar and he walks half the way there daily. So you can accompany him for a walk till Muksteshwar whenever you want. You need to take a shared cab to a village called 'Shitla' and then walk all the way to Mukteshwar. It's a 4-5kms hike one way. Have some breakfast at Mukteshwar and then he will accompany you back to the homestay after finishing his work. He usually takes an hour to finish his work. Overall, I had an amazing stay at Maya's homestay and would strongly recommend you to book this property.

This is a beautiful and quaint homestay in an equally quaint village. Maya didi, the host and her family are amazing and hospitable people. The room is extremely aesthetically done, very clean, and had all the required arrangements. The food is cooked by Maya didi herself, which is delicious and you get to experience a different kind of cuisine. Their dogs Rocky and Daboo are absolute darlings and so is their cat Kuku! The co-host Sriparna and her family is also a great addition to this place. We celebrated Mita auntie's birthday in the most adorable way possible. Overall, we had a lovely experience here and we can't wait to come back and chill for a few days! If you truly want to have a homestay experience, this is your place to be.

Location is offbeat and secluded from main road so no noise except birds chirping and natural insect sounds. It feels like harmony with nature and beautiful valley view from the location and a lot of fresh fruits and excellent host.

This was one of the most wonderful trips I have had and quite a memorable one. I went in with no expectations but just a relaxing break from a fast paced life. But this trip was so much more and all thanks to Maya's Homestay.A beautiful room at overlooks the mountains, fresh apricots from the strees, two cute dogs and a cat to cuddle with and the most delicious home-cooked meals that feltlike a warm hug. When it was time to leave, it was obviously very difficult. I will miss the hikes, the furry cuddles, the sunsets and all the kind people. I hope to visit this place soon and for longer this time around. Many thanks for the hosts for being so wonderful and making this trip memorable.
